text.p: Microsoft Corp is set to announce it will invest $150 million in Apple Computer Inc, sources close to Microsoft said on Wednesday.
The following are trader and market analyst reactions:

ARNIE OWEN, MANAGING DIRECTOR OF CAPITAL MARKETS, CRUTTENDEN ROTH: "That should ensure (Apple) being around for a while...It's the biggest guy you could get to support you. That doesn't say that Apple is a great company but there are parts of it that are worthwhile."

GUY TRUICKO, PORTFOLIO MANAGER, UNITY MANAGEMENT: "It's a very positive move for Apple." Cited addition of Steve Jobs, Larry Ellison, Jerry York and Bill Campbell to Apple's board. "The stock should be up today on that news. It seems like it's getting a big shot in the arm."

PETER COOLIDGE, SENIOR EQUITY TRADER AT BREAN MURRAY & CO: "It's a positive for Apple because everybody was wondering how they were going to get financing and this gives them a new lease on life. It's a positive for Microsoft because it shows they are willing to go in new directions and it's probably a positive for the tech sector."
